Description:
A SUPERB PERIOD HOME IN PRIVATE GARDEN SETTING OF 1775M2
Beyond the private, secluded driveway awaits this magnificent period home which has been loved, meticulously renovated and extended over the past thirty-three years to what is now a magnificent character filled property on approximately 1,775m2 in one of Kennington's most sought-after locations. Positioned within walking distance to Primary and Secondary Colleges, Supermarket and Post Office and an easy 15 minute walk to the CBD.
The home boasts over 26 squares of quality living on two levels with polished Baltic Pine and Tassie Oak floors, high ceilings, ornate fire places, double-hung timber windows, elaborate light fittings and some leadlight all adding to its charm. There's central gas heating and evaporative cooling throughout for comfort.
Up-stairs are three bedrooms with built in robes (each with Noirot heaters), a foyer or study and a bathroom - the ideal kids retreat. The spacious main bedroom is on ground level and includes a brand-new quality en-suite and walk-through robe. Adjacent is the fifth bedroom which is currently used as a library which features a large built-in bookshelf, customised filing drawers and an open fire place.
Living space is abundant with a large formal carpeted lounge boasting high ceilings and big sash-windows, feature wood heater and unique antique pendant lighting. The formal dining room (or multi-purpose) is adjacent with access outside. The kitchen is modern with a country twist and includes Jarrah bench-tops and a leadlight feature window, good storage and European appliances. The living hub includes a spacious meals area and open-plan family room which features a beautiful bay window overlooking the rear garden and French Doors accessing the large paved outdoor space. The third bathroom (with sunken spa), laundry and foyer/study nook are all handy to the living hub.
The yard is very private and boasts numerous beautiful established trees including Silver Birch, Cape Chestnut, Indian Bean, Manchurian Pears and various fruit trees. The yard is flat and square offering space for a pool, large shed and tennis court STCA. There is a double carport, 4m x 6m approx. workshop; two water tanks and 12 solar panels and much more.
This is a one-off chance to buy a home with such history and character and size with an irreplaceable, private established garden only two-minute drive to Bendigo's CBD.
Inspection by appointment at anytime available - call Brad Hinton on 0417 537 251.

Description:
FAMILY HOME IN POPULAR KENNINGTON LOCALE
Perfectly positioned in a pretty street only a few blocks from Strath Village and La Trobe University is this much-loved family home. With spacious rooms and a practical, contemporary layout, this property offers plenty of curb appeal with a neat and private landscaped front yard.
A wide formal entry leads, to one side, directly to one of four bedrooms in the property. To the other side of the entry is a large master bedroom. With glass doors opening to the rear yard, this great space also includes a walk-in robe and a spacious ensuite with a walk-in shower. Two further bedrooms can be found on the other side of the home, along with a family bathroom; separate toilet; and a large laundry with fantastic storage and access to the side of the home.
In the heart of the house is a great-sized, open plan kitchen, living and dining room. The kitchen features a sizable central island bench and plenty of storage, along with a neat office nook. Off the kitchen is a second spacious living area that also offers access to the main hallway.
Sliding doors from both living areas open out to a huge pergola creating a fantastic alfresco space. The multi-level decked area includes a built-in, fully fenced outdoor spa, creating a fantastic entertainment space. At the bottom of the garden is a low-maintenance paved courtyard and garden beds that are home to established fruit trees including olives, limes and apricots. Tucked away in the corner of the backyard is a great workshed, offering extra storage, living space or simple a spot to tinker in.
Additional features include:
Ducted gas in-floor heating and ducted evaporative cooling
Wood fire heater in main living
Ceiling fans in each bedroom and in main living
Kitchen appliances including four-burner gas cooktop, oven with separate grill and dishwasher
Secure access from the double garage to the inside of the house
Additional room off the garage (ideal for workshop, storage or home office)
Wide side access to the rear yard from the front of the property (perfect for trailer storage)
This great family home is located in a pretty, quiet street close to all amenities. With a peaceful outlook, the rear garden is private and tranquil, and the interior layout is absolutely ideal for a family of any age or stage and the close proximity to the university makes it a good investment opportunity.

Description:
Solid Brick Family Home In Great Kennington Location
Located in a tightly held Kennington location, this solid brick family home is just a few blocks from Strath Village and Brennan Park Swimming Pool, and less than five minutes to Bendigo’s CBD. Set back from the road in a quiet street, the property features a neat landscaped front garden and excellent off street parking.
Indoors, a spacious formal entry hall with timber paneling leads to a hallway and, through double doors, into an L-shaped lounge. Sliding doors on one side, and floor-to-ceiling windows on the other, fill the space with natural light. An exposed brick wall and fireplace create a cosy feel, with a ceiling fan and gas wall heater adding extra comfort. A door from the lounge leads into a kitchen and dining area. Ample storage can be found in the galley kitchen, and a glass slider opens out to the rear yard.
Off the main hallway are three good-sized bedrooms. The master offers a walk-in robe and an ensuite, and the remaining two bedrooms have ceiling fans and built-in robes. A family bathroom, separate toilet, linen closet and spacious laundry with side door complete the design.
Outdoors, a brick paved terrace runs along the rear of the property, overlooking neat garden beds and a lawn area. A single roller door provides vehicle access from the garage, and a garden shed at the rear of the property offers additional storage.
Additional features include:
Split system heating and cooling in kitchen-diner and ceiling fans throughout
Four-burner electric cooktop and oven with separate grill in kitchen
Access from both sides of the property into the rear garden
Water tanks x 2 (25,000l and 500l)
Motorised roller doors to double garage
This quality solid brick home has been beautifully maintained over the years and provides a modern, family-friendly layout and plenty of potential. With only cosmetic alterations required, this is an excellent investment or a great opportunity to step on to the property ladder in a fantastic location.
